glsa.title: Cyrus-SASL: Buffer overflow and SASL_PATH vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Cyrus-SASL contains two vulnerabilities that might allow an attacker to completely compromise the vulnerable system.

background.p: Cyrus-SASL is an implementation of the Simple Authentication and Security Layer.

description.p: Cyrus-SASL contains a remote buffer overflow in the digestmda5.c file. Additionally, under certain conditions it is possible for a local user to exploit a vulnerability in the way the SASL_PATH environment variable is honored (CAN-2004-0884).

impact.p: An attacker might be able to execute arbitrary code with the Effective ID of the application calling the Cyrus-SASL libraries.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
